Name: Jean Bartik
Description: "For programming and co-leading the first teams of ENIAC programmers
Topics: and for pioneering work on BINAC and UNIVAC I."

Name: Jean Bartik
Topics: "For programming the ENIAC computer and helping adapt it to use software programs stored in memory."

Name: Alan J. Perlis
Description: "For his influence in the area of advanced programming techniques and compiler construction."
Topics: "Early computers

Name: Maurice Wilkes
Description: "For his work on the EDASC
Topics: an early stored-program computer. And also for authoring
Source: a volume on 'Preparation of Programs for Electronic Digital Computers'
column8: in which program libraries were effectively introduced."

Name: Richard Hamming
Description: "For his work on numerical methods
Topics: automatic coding systems

Name: Marvin Minsky
Description: "For his central role in creating
Topics: shaping
Source: and advancing the field of Artificial Intelligence."

Name: James H. Wilkinson
Description: "For his research in numerical analysis to facilitiate the use of the high-speed digital computer
Topics: having received special recognition for his work in computations in linear algebra and 'backward' error analysis."

Name: John McCarthy
Description: "For his work in promoting and continuing the field of Artificial Intelligence. And also for his work in Lisp."
Topics: Artificial intelligence, Programming languages, Programming paradigms

Name: Edsger W. Dijkstra
Description: "For fundamental contributions to programming as a high
Topics: intellectual challenge; for eloquent insistence and practical demonstration that programs should be composed correctly
Tags: not just debugged into correctness; for illuminating perception of problems at the foundations of program design."

Name: Charles Bachman
Description: "For his outstanding contributions to database technology."
Topics: "Databases"

Name: Donald Knuth
Description: "For his major contributions to the analysis of algorithms and the design of programming languages
Topics: and in particular for his contributions to the 'art of computer programming' through his well-known books in a continuous series by this title."

Name: Allen Newell
Description: "In joint scientific efforts extending over twenty years
Topics: initially in collaboration with J. C. Shaw at the RAND Corporation
Tags: and subsequentially with numerous faculty and student collegues at Carnegie-Mellon University
Source: Newell and co-recipient #{Herbert A. Simon} made basic contributions to artificial intelligence

Name: Herbert A. Simon
Description: "In joint scientific efforts extending over twenty years
Topics: initially in collaboration with J. C. Shaw at the RAND Corporation
Tags: and subsequentially with numerous faculty and student collegues at Carnegie-Mellon University
Source: Simon and co-recipient #{Allen Newell} made basic contributions to artificial intelligence
column11: Human-computer interaction, List processing, Logic theory machine, General problem solver, Turing award

Name: Michael O. Rabin
Description: "Along with #{Dana S. Scott}
Topics: for their joint paper 'Finite Automata and Their Decision Problem' which introduced the idea of nondeterministic machines
Tags: which has proved to be an enormously valuable concept. Their (Scott & Rabin) classic paper has been a continuous source of inspiration for subsequent work in this field."

Name: Dana S. Scott
Description: "Along with #{Michael O. Rabin}
Topics: for their joint paper 'Finite Automata and Their Decision Problem'
Tags: which introduced the idea of nondeterministic machines
Source: which has proved to be an enormously valuable concept. Their (Scott & Rabin) classic paper has been a continuous source of inspiration for subsequent work in this field."

Name: John Backus
Description: "For profound
Topics: influential
Tags: and lasting contributions to the design of practical high-level programming systems
Source: notably through his work on FORTRAN
column8: and for seminal publication of formal procedures for the specification of programming languages."

Name: Robert W. Floyd
Description: "For having a clear influence on methodologies for the creation of efficient and reliable software
Topics: and for helping to found the following important subfields of computer science: the theory of parsing

Name: Kenneth E. Iverson
Description: "For his pioneering effort in programming languages and mathematical notation resulting in what the computing field now knows as APL
Topics: for his contributions to the implementation of interactive systems
Source: and to programming language theory and practice."

Name: C. A. R. Hoare
Description: "For his fundamental contributions to the definition and design of programming languages."
Topics: "Programming languages

Name: Edgar F. Codd
Description: "For his fundamental and continuing contributions to the theory and practice of database management systems."
Topics: "Databases"

Name: Stephen Cook
Description: "For his advancement of our understanding of the complexity of computation in a significant and profound way."
Topics: "Theoretical computer science"

Name: Ken Thompson
Description: "With #{Dennis Ritchie}
Topics: for their development of generic operating systems theory and specifically for the implementation of the UNIX operating system."

Name: Dennis Ritchie
Description: "With #{Ken Thompson}
Topics: for their development of generic operating systems theory and specifically for the implementation of the UNIX operating system."

Name: Niklaus Wirth
Description: "For developing a sequence of innovative computer languages
Topics: EULER
Source: MODULA and PASCAL. PASCAL has become pedagogically significant and has provided a foundation for future computer language

Name: Richard M. Karp
Description: "For his continuing contributions to the theory of algorithms including the development of efficient algorithms for network flow and other combinatorial optimization problems
Topics: the identification of polynomial-time computability with the intuitive notion of algorithmic efficiency
column8: contributions to the theory of NP-completeness."

Name: John Hopcroft
Description: "With #{Robert Tarjan}
Topics: for fundamental achievements in the design and analysis of algorithms and data structures."

Name: Robert Tarjan
Description: "With #{John Hopcroft}
Topics: for fundamental achievements in the design and analysis of algorithms and data structures."

Name: John Cocke
Description: "For significant contributions in the design and theory of compilers
Topics: the architecture of large systems and the development of reduced instruction set computers (RISC)."

Name: Ivan Sutherland
Description: "For his pioneering and visionary contributions to computer graphics
Topics: starting with Sketchpad

Name: William Kahan
Description: "For his fundamental contributions to numerical analysis and in becoming one of the foremost experts on floating-point computations."
Topics: "Theoretical computer science"

Name: Fernando J. Corbató
Description: "For his pioneering work organizing the concepts and leading the development of the general-purpose
Topics: large-scale

Name: Robin Milner
Description: "For three distinct and complete achievements: LCF
Topics: the mechanization of Scott's Logic of Computable Functions
Tags: probably the first theoretically based yet practical tool for machine assisted proof construction; The creation of the ML language; and CCS
column8: Theoretical computer science, Programming languages, Concurrency

Name: Butler W. Lampson
Description: For contributions to the development of distributed, personal computing environments and the technology for their implementation: workstations, networks, operating systems, programming systems, displays, security and document publishing.
Topics: Operating systems

Name: Juris Hartmanis
Description: With #{Richard E. Stearns}, in recognition of their seminal paper which established the foundations for the field of computational complexity theory.
Topics: Theoretical computer science
Tags: Time complexity, Berman–Hartmanis conjecture, Turing award

Name: Richard E. Stearns
Description: "With #{Juris Hartmanis}
Topics: in recognition of their seminal paper which established the foundations for the field of computational complexity theory."

Name: Edward Feigenbaum
Description: "For pioneering the design and construction of large scale artificial intelligence systems
Topics: demonstrating the practical importance and potential commercial impact of artificial intelligence technology."

Name: Raj Reddy
Description: "For pioneering the design and construction of large scale artificial intelligence systems
Topics: demonstrating the practical importance and potential commercial impact of artificial intelligence technology."

Name: Manuel Blum
Description: "In recognition of his contributions to the foundations of computational complexity theory and its application to cryptography and program checking."
Topics: "Theoretical computer science

Name: Amir Pnueli
Description: "For seminal work introducing temporal logic into computing science and for outstanding contributions to program and system verification."
Topics: "Theoretical computer science"

Name: Douglas Engelbart
Description: "For an inspiring vision of the future of interactive computing and the invention of key technologies to help realize this vision."
Topics: "Early computers

Name: Jim Gray
Description: "For seminal contributions to database and transaction processing research and technical leadership in system implementation."
Topics: "Databases"

Name: Frederick P. Brooks
Description: "For landmark contributions to computer architecture
Topics: operating systems

Name: Andrew Chi-Chih Yao
Description: "In recognition of his fundamental contributions to the theory of computation
Topics: including the complexity-based theory of pseudorandom number generation

Name: Ole-Johan Dahl
Description: "With #{Kristen Nygaard}
Topics: for ideas fundamental to the emergence of object oriented programming
Tags: through their design of the programming languages #{Simula I|Simula} and #{Simula 67|Simula}."

Name: Kristen Nygaard
Description: "With #{Ole-Johan Dahl}
Topics: for ideas fundamental to the emergence of object oriented programming
Tags: through their design of the programming languages #{Simula I|Simula} and #{Simula 67|Simula}."

Name: Ronald L. Rivest
Description: "Together with #{Leonard Adleman} and #{Adi Shamir}
Topics: for their ingenious contribution to making public-key cryptography useful in practice."

Name: Adi Shamir
Description: "Together with #{Leonard Adleman} and #{Ronald L. Rivest}
Topics: for their ingenious contribution to making public-key cryptography useful in practice."

Name: Leonard Adleman
Description: "Together with #{Ronald L. Rivest} and #{Adi Shamir}
Topics: for their ingenious contribution to making public-key cryptography useful in practice."

Name: Alan Kay
Description: "For pioneering many of the ideas at the root of contemporary object-oriented programming languages
Topics: leading the team that developed Smalltalk
Tags: and for fundamental contributions to personal computing."

Name: Vint Cerf
Description: "With #{Bob Kahn}
Topics: for pioneering work on internetworking
Tags: including the design and implementation of the Internet's basic communications protocols
column8: and for inspired leadership in networking."

Name: Bob Kahn
Description: "With #{Vint Cerf}
Topics: for pioneering work on internetworking
Tags: including the design and implementation of the Internet's basic communications protocols
column8: and for inspired leadership in networking."

Name: Peter Naur
Description: "For fundamental contributions to programming language design and the definition of Algol 60
Topics: to compiler design
Tags: and to the art and practice of computer programming."

Name: Frances E. Allen
Description: "For pioneering contributions to the theory and practice of optimizing compiler techniques that laid the foundation for modern optimizing compilers and automatic parallel execution."
Topics: "Programming languages

Name: E. Allen Emerson
Description: "Together with #{Edmund M. Clarke} and #{Joseph Sifakis}
Topics: for their role in developing Model-Checking into a highly effective verification technology that is widely adopted in the hardware and software industries."

Name: Edmund M. Clarke
Description: "Together with #{E. Allen Emerson} and #{Joseph Sifakis}
Topics: for their role in developing Model-Checking into a highly effective verification technology that is widely adopted in the hardware and software industries."

Name: Joseph Sifakis
Description: "Together with #{Edmund M. Clarke} and #{E. Allen Emerson}
Topics: for their role in developing Model-Checking into a highly effective verification technology that is widely adopted in the hardware and software industries."

Name: Barbara Liskov
Description: "For contributions to practical and theoretical foundations of programming language and system design
Topics: especially related to data abstraction

Name: Charles P. Thacker
Description: "For the pioneering design and realization of the first modern personal computer -- the Alto at Xerox PARC -- and seminal inventions and contributions to local area networks (including the Ethernet)
Topics: multiprocessor workstations

Name: Leslie G. Valiant
Description: "For transformative contributions to the theory of computation
Topics: including the theory of probably approximately correct (PAC) learning
Tags: the complexity of enumeration and of algebraic computation
Source: and the theory of parallel and distributed computing."

Name: Judea Pearl
Description: "For fundamental contributions to artificial intelligence through the development of a calculus for probabilistic and causal reasoning."
Topics: "Artificial intelligence"

Name: Silvio Micali
Description: "Along with #{Shafi Goldwasser}
Topics: for transformative work that laid the complexity-theoretic foundations for the science of cryptography
Tags: and in the process pioneered new methods for efficient verification of mathematical proofs in complexity theory."

Name: Shafi Goldwasser
Description: "Along with #{Silvio Micali}
Topics: for transformative work that laid the complexity-theoretic foundations for the science of cryptography
Tags: and in the process pioneered new methods for efficient verification of mathematical proofs in complexity theory."

Name: Leslie Lamport
Description: "For fundamental contributions to the theory and practice of distributed and concurrent systems
Topics: notably the invention of concepts such as causality and logical clocks

Name: Michael Stonebraker
Description: "For fundamental contributions to the concepts and practices underlying modern database systems."
Topics: "Databases"

Name: Martin E. Hellman
Description: "Along with #{Whitfield Diffie}
Topics: for critical contributions to modern cryptography."

Name: Whitfield Diffie
Description: "Along with #{Martin E. Hellman}
Topics: for critical contributions to modern cryptography."

Name: Tim Berners-Lee
Description: "For inventing the #{World Wide Web}
Topics: the first web browser
Tags: and the fundamental protocols and algorithms allowing the Web to scale."

Name: Jean E. Sammet
Topics: "For her contribution to the development of programming languages with #{FORMAC} and #{COBOL}."
